intro: Graffenrieda emarginata, commonly known as the margined graffenrieda, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and ecological studies.
